result.execSummary:
All charges against Felix M Avina in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Felix M Avina is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felix M Avina

records.addlTxt:
09:01 AM Defendant Felix M Avina in court/in person.  Adam T. Stuart appeared for the Wisconsin, State of by phone.
  950/Marsy's Law complied with. Deft had a pre-trial conf on 2.22.22. State moves to dismiss, co-deft rcvd different offer per ADA Gabler's notes. Court grants dismissal.

Pre-trial conference on February 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing on March 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:11 PM Defendant Felix M Avina in the courtroom. Joan M. Korb appeared by phone for the Wisconsin, State of.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Deft. advised of rights, rcvd. criminal complaint/reading waived. 
Charges and penalties read by the Court. 
NG plea entered on all Counts. Bond set and signed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:
  No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property.
  Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
  Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Initial appearance on January 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
